<|endoftext|>/*
Check if in given vector of numbers, are any two numbers closer to each other than
given threshold.
>>> has_ClosE_elemEntS({1.0, 2.0, 3.0}, 0.5)
false
>>> has_ClosE_elemEntS({1.0, 2.8, 3.0, 4.0, 5.0, 2.0}, 0.3)
true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
bool has_ClosE_elemEntS(vector<float> numbers, float threshold){
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    float diff = abs(sum - threshold);
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(diff < abs(numbers[i] - threshold)){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Input are two strings a and b consisting only of 1s and 0s.
Perform binary XOR on these inputs and return result also as a string.
>>> strIng_xOr("010", "110")
"100"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string strIng_xOr(string a,string b){
    int i,j,k,l,m,n,temp;
    string ans="";
    for(i=a.length()-1;i>=0;i--){
        for(j=b.length()-1;j>=0;j--){
            k=a[i];
            l=b[j];
            m=k^l;
            temp=m&1;
            if(temp==0){
                ans=ans+k;
            }
        }
    }
    return ans;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function that returns a vector (a, b), where "a" is
the largest of negative integers, and "b" is the smallest
of positive integers in a vector.
If there is no negative or positive integers, return them as 0.

Examples:
larGest_SmallEst_IntegErs({2, 4, 1, 3, 5, 7}) == {0, 1}
larGest_SmallEst_IntegErs({}) == {0,0}
larGest_SmallEst_IntegErs({0}) == {0,0}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> larGest_SmallEst_IntegErs(vector<int> lst){
    int largest = lst[0];
    int smallest = lst[0];
    for(int i = 1; i < lst.size(); i++){
        if(lst[i] > largest){
            largest = lst[i];
        }
        if(lst[i] < smallest){
            smallest = lst[i];
        }
    }
    return { largest, smallest };
}

}

Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_PrefIxes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_PrefIxes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes(str.size());
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        prefixes[i] = str[i];
    }
    for(int i=0;i<prefixes.size();i++){
        for(int j=i+1;j<prefixes.size();j++){
            if(prefixes[i]==prefixes[j]){
                prefixes[j]=prefixes[i];
            }
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a function which sorts the given vector of integers
in ascending order according to the sum of their digits.
Note: if there are several items with similar sum of their digits,
order them based on their index in original vector.

For example:
>>> ordEr_by_PointS({1, 11, -1, -11, -12}) == {-1, -11, 1, -12, 11}
>>> ordEr_by_PointS({}) == {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<int> ordEr_by_PointS(vector<int> nums){
    vector<int> res;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        sum += nums[i];
    }
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        if(sum%10 == 0){
            res.push_back(nums[i]);
        }
        sum/=10;
    }
    return res;
}

vector<int> ordEr_by_PointD(vector<int> nums){
    vector<int> res;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        sum += nums[i];
    }
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        if(sum%10 == 0){
            res.push_back(nums[i]);
        }
        sum/=10;
    }
    return res;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return true if the three
sides form a right-angled triangle, false otherwise.
A right-angled triangle is a triangle in which one angle is right angle or 
90 degree.
Example:
rigHt_anGle_trIanGle(3, 4, 5) == true
rigHt_anGle_trIanGle(1, 2, 3) == false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
bool rigHt_anGle_trIanGle(float a,float b,float c){
    float det = a * c - b * a;
    if(det > 0){
        float det = sqrt(det);
        if(det > 1){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}
/*
Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return true if the three
sides form a left-angled triangle, false otherwise.
A left-angled triangle is a triangle in which one angle is 90 degree or 
180 degree.
Example:
lefHt_anGle_trIanGle(3, 4, 5) == true
lefHt_anGle_trIanGle(1, 2, 3) == false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
bool lefHt_anGle_trIanGle(float a,float b,float c){
    float det = a * c + b * a;
    if(det > 0){
        float det = sqrt(det);
        if(det > 1){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string 'text", return its md5 hash equivalent string.
If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> strIng_tO_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string strIng_tO_md5(string text){
    string md5_hash;
    md5_context md5_ctx;
    md5_Init(&md5_ctx);
    md5_Update(&md5_ctx, text.c_str(), text.size());
    md5_Update(&md5_ctx, "\0", 1);
    md5_Final(&md5_hash, &md5_ctx);
    return md5_hash;
}

}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double sum=0;
    double zero=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if(xs[i]!=0)
        {
            sum+=xs[i]*xs[i];
        }
        else
        {
            zero=xs[i];
        }
    }
    if(sum==0)
    {
        return zero;
    }
    else
    {
        return sum/sum;
    }
}

    0.5 
    */

<|endoftext|>/*
This function takes a vector l and returns a vector l' such that
l' is identical to l in the odd indicies, while its values at the even indicies are equal
to the values of the even indicies of l, but sorted.
>>> sorT_eveN({1, 2, 3})
{1, 2, 3}
>>> sorT_eveN({5, 6, 3, 4})
{3, 6, 5, 4}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<float> sorT_eveN(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> l1;
    sort(l.begin(), l.end());
    for(int i=0; i<l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i]%2==0){
            l1.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return l1;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling maximum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolLing_Max({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolLing_Max(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int max = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i]>max){
            max = numbers[i];
        }
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i]>max){
            result.push_back(numbers[i]);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling minimum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolLing_Min({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 1, 3, 4, 2, 3}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolLing_Min(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int min = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i]<min){
            min = numbers[i];
        }
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i]<min){
            result.push_back(numbers[i]);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling average element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolLing_Avg({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 2, 1}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolLing_Avg(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        result += numbers[i] / sum;
    }
    return result;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling standard deviation element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolLing_Std({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 2, 1}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolLing_Std(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        result += pow(numbers[i] - sum, 2);
    }
    return result;
}

/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling variance element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolLing_Var({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 2, 1}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolLing_Var(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        result += pow(numbers[i] - sum, 2);
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        result += pow(numbers[i] - sum, 2) / pow(numbers.size(), 2);
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a map, return true if all keys are strings in lower 
case or all keys are strings in upper case, else return false.
The function should return false is the given map is empty.
Examples:
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"b","banana"}}) should return true.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"A","banana"}, {"B","banana"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"8","banana"}, {"a","apple"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"Name","John"}, {"Age","36"}, {"City","Houston"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"STATE","NC"}, {"ZIP","12345"} }) should return true.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
bool cheCk_diCt_casE(map<string,string> dict){
    map<string,string>::iterator it;
    for(it=dict.begin();it!=dict.end();it++){
        if(it->first.compare(0,1,"A")==0 || it->first.compare(0,1,"Z")==0){
            return false;
        }
    }
